function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Image risk of a country due to covid-19 outbreak","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Perception of higher covid-19 infection risk due to proximity to out-group members and unfamiliar environments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological risk associated with undesirable travel experience and pandemic-related anxiety","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social risk related to negative changes in others’ opinions and attitudes towards travelers in a tourism context","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived uncertainty of infection and negative outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of affected areas and neighboring countries to crisis events and negative destination image","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in risk perception between tourists, policymakers, and industry practitioners","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High-power representations of nuclear energy result in abstract construal, leading to reduced risk perception and increased optimism, potentially affecting attitudes towards nuclear energy.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Psychological closeness to environmental pollution leads to a more concrete threat perception and greater perceived risk.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Proximate psychological distance and low-level construal may lead to reduced risk perception of covid-19, potentially impacting safety behaviors and precautionary measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Subjective perceived risk in travel context influences tourists’ destination choices and travel behavior.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tourism industry is highly susceptible to internal and external stimuli, including perceived risk in crisis contexts.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 through person-to-person contact","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proven treatment for covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased perceived risk due to closer psychological distance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Proximity of temporal distance and spatial distance in relation to covid-19 increases psychological closeness and low construal, leading to a focus on immediate pandemic-related context and details.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fear of covid-19 transmission to families and friends due to close social distance within the in-group, leading to protective measures and enforced quarantine measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mandatory quarantine measures leading to social isolation and potential mental health implications.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Implicit associations between proximate objects and low-level construal may affect judgment and decisions unconsciously, leading to potential misjudgments of contagion risk.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Psychological distance and construal level theory may lead to underestimation of the severity and controllability of epidemics, potentially leading to complacency and lack of preparedness.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological distance and perception of low hypotheticality may lead to the perception of control over contagion, potentially leading to risky behavior and inadequate precautions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of psychological distance and its impact on contagious rooms.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying on sensor-only estimation of people flow","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on estimation
